verses.kjv: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
verses.ct: On the 3rd day, a wedding took place in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.

verses.kjv: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.
verses.ct: Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.

verses.kjv: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
verses.ct: When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus told him, "They don't have any more wine."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Woman, why are you involving me in this? My time hasn't arrived yet."

verses.kjv: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
verses.ct: His mother told the servants, "Whatever he tells you to do, do it."

verses.kjv: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.
verses.ct: Nearby stood 6 stone water jars used for Jewish ceremonial washing, each holding about 20 to 30 gallons.

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Fill the jars with water." So they filled them all the way to the top.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Now scoop some out and take it to the master of the banquet." So they brought it to him.

verses.kjv: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,
verses.ct: When the master of the banquet tasted the water that had become wine, he had no idea where it came from — though the servants who had drawn the water knew. He called the groom over

verses.kjv: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.
verses.ct: and said to him, "Everyone serves the best wine first, and then brings out the cheaper stuff after the guests have had plenty to drink. But you've saved the best wine until now!"

verses.kjv: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.
verses.ct: This was the first of Jesus' miraculous signs, performed in Cana of Galilee. Through it he revealed his glory, and his disciples put their faith in him.

verses.kjv: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.
verses.ct: After this, Jesus went down to Capernaum with his mother, his brothers, and his disciples, and they stayed there for a few days.

verses.kjv: And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
verses.ct: The Jewish Passover was approaching, so Jesus traveled up to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:
verses.ct: In the temple courts he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, along with money changers sitting at their tables.

verses.kjv: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;
verses.ct: So he made a whip out of cords and drove them all out of the temple, including the sheep and cattle. He scattered the money changers' coins and flipped over their tables.

verses.kjv: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.
verses.ct: To those selling doves he said, "Get all of this out of here! Stop turning my Father's house into a marketplace!"

verses.kjv: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.
verses.ct: His disciples recalled the Scripture that says, "Passion for your house will consume me."

verses.kjv: Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders confronted him and demanded, "What sign can you show us to prove you have the authority to do this?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "Tear down this temple, and in 3 days I will rebuild it."

verses.kjv: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders replied, "This temple took 46 years to construct, and you're going to rebuild it in 3 days?"

verses.kjv: But he spake of the temple of his body.
verses.ct: But the temple he was talking about was his own body.

verses.kjv: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
verses.ct: So after he rose from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the Scripture and the words Jesus had spoken.

verses.kjv: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.
verses.ct: While Jesus was in Jerusalem during the Passover festival, many people put their faith in his name because they witnessed the miraculous signs he was performing.

verses.kjv: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men,
verses.ct: But Jesus did not entrust himself to them, because he understood human nature completely.

verses.kjv: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
verses.ct: He didn't need anyone to tell him about people, because he already knew what was inside every person.
